reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My grandson is a Minecraft nut. When I gave him this book at Christmas, he didn't look at another gift because he was so busy reading it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nephew loves it
reviews.reviewText: Got it for my 9 yo ADHD nephew who doesn’t like school but loves Minecraft. He’s already read it several times trying to get different endings. Mission accomplished.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Son Loves It!
reviews.reviewText: My son loves this book and it really holds his attention. The character's voice is relatable and the world detail is great. My son is very excited to keep exploring different endings.I should add that my son struggles with reading so we do this as a read aloud.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my sons birthday and he loved it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hours of entertainment!
reviews.reviewText: My son is really into Minecraft right now, and I am not about to buy him some fan based graphic novel. I decided to go with an author who’s been writing many of the pick your own adventure books. A series of books both the county librarian and the school librarian suggested for him to read with his advanced reading levels since he’s only six. He’s read probably all the versions at least twenty times already only having this book a month or so. It holds his interests because there are options AND it’s Minecraft! She wrote three! So when I can get some more money I want to buy him the other two for him to enjoy reading since reading can be hard for him being so young, but being so advanced. How can you find that perfect balance of the right content for someone so young and with so many challenges to go through a short attention span. So this book is just a perfect option for that sort of kid. I’m really glad I got this one. And I can’t wait to get the other two for him. And eventually more pick your own adventures for him to enjoy beyond Minecraft.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My sons loved this book
reviews.reviewText: My boys, 6 and 4 years old, loved listening to me read this book to them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Pretty good, but I will list the things that make it 3 star, instead of 4 or 5. 1:Its not 100% accurate to Minecraft. First the wolf, they don't attack any mob unless it or its owner is provoked, besides skeletons of course. Also there are giraffes, elephants, and some food. But it DOES say that "you have never seen this is Minecraft before." Which alright. 2: grammar & spelling. I wouldn't say "poorly" written but there are some grammatical and spelling errors, but its fin. Now that I've explained why its not perfect, you may think its a bad idea to get it, but get it its good

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Son said its a fun book
reviews.reviewText: My 9 year old son LOVES this book. Its a book he reads on his own and has said "This book is so much fun!" He loves how he can pick his own things to change the outcome.I love this book because even though he already loved to read, he would always have this book with him. When we would be in the car he would read it outloud and let his younger sister pick between the options.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: My son does not enjoy reading which is such a shame. We read this together with a bit more support than usual (smallish type and a lots of words). Taking turns ensured that we could keep the speed/interest up. After a little wobble following our first ‘bad ending’ we really got into this book and we’ve been back to work out how to get to every ending. He’s actually suggested reading and been keen to find out what happens next. The relatively short sections make reading in short bursts possible. Recommend for any Minecraft-savvy reluctant reader. Mine is 8yrs old.
I do like the fact it takes you to other pages but the book was very short. From an 11 year old reader.

reviews.reviewTitle: If your child likes to read they will love it
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't sure that my daughter would like it as she plays minecraft online. However, she did like it.
Decent product. However if you have to return it, will cost you more than it's worth. Use a different supplier's. I won't buy from this one again.
